class openassembly.pirate_reputation.models.ReputationManager[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.manager.Manager

get_user_score(user, dimension=None)[source]¶
register_event(event_score, user, dimension=None, related_object=None, initiator=None, calculator=<function <lambda> at 0x46786e0>, aggregator=<function <lambda> at 0x4678758>)[source]¶

When an event is registered, it is possible to supply function callbacks that are used to calculate the improvment in the single-dimension score (i.e. calculator), as well as to calculate the improvement in the aggregate score (i.e. aggregator).

If neither of these are specified, which is the usual case, then the event_score is simply used without alteration.

transitive_vote(vote, user, dtype, old_vote=None)[source]¶

When a vote is registered in the reputation system, the vote type is normalized into a Consensus object stored for each user, allowing ease in accessing distributions of other user’s votes for this user.

tests Module¶

This file demonstrates two different styles of tests (one doctest and one unittest). These will both pass when you run “manage.py test”.

Replace these with more appropriate tests for your application.

Tests that 1 + 1 always equals 2.
